body_html:
@soumith
It looks like the use of the use of --version-script (pytorch.version) was removed in this commit: 92f54e1. So now all symbols are being globally exported.

For example, in pytorch v0.4.1, this command shows many more symbols are exported than that version map would allow.

nm -Dg torch/_C.so

Should the --version-script be added it back in?
body_text:
@soumith
It looks like the use of the use of --version-script (pytorch.version) was removed in this commit: 92f54e1. So now all symbols are being globally exported.
For example, in pytorch v0.4.1, this command shows many more symbols are exported than that version map would allow.
nm -Dg torch/_C.so
Should the --version-script be added it back in?
body:
@soumith 
It looks like the use of the use of --version-script (pytorch.version) was removed in this commit: pytorch@92f54e1f0152ccee11cdcf5a60c7b8eff9fddef7. So now all symbols are being globally exported.

For example, in pytorch v0.4.1, this command shows many more symbols are exported than that version map would allow.
```bash
nm -Dg torch/_C.so
```

Should the `--version-script` be added it back in?
